intro: Rauia racemosa, commonly known as the clustered rauia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Rauia racemosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
